title: Any one can view collaborater email address via  path /reports/<id>/participants

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Hello team,

I can able to find while inviting a collaborator to my report i must enter his/her username or mail id but what if the user doesnt have an account in hackerone we need to gave the email so i gave an email to invite a collaborator and i viewed the request in burp below.


Step to reproduce:

1:  select a report of yours 
2: add a user to that report as collaborator with an email of unaccounted user in hackerone
3: now after successfully invited that collaborator view the below request

```
GET /reports/<REPORT ID>/participants HTTP/2
Host: hackerone.com
Cookie: h1_device_id=da6b4e1e-7e67-46fc-85f0-b7eb0ce35f63; __Host-%3D%3D--6dc5688902c36c0edb857120e9bd8665e5170af5; cf_clearance=5vpfeLN93oq5Ya6zAU922X6WutTn5zr1K6sJZLcC_vM-1679832536-0-160; AMP_; _dd_s=rum=0&expire=1679838753537; AMP_MKTG_b7cba2c14c=JTdCJTIycmVmZXJyZXIlMjIlM0ElMjJodHRwcyUzQSUyRiUyRmhhY2tlcm9uZS5jb20lMkZ1c2VycyUyRnNpZ25faW4lM0ZfX2NmX2NobF90ayUzRHA4cDlfbWFhNmYwVVFGVG9sc2ZPUGdXZ3lITVZhQXhkQ0kyeS42QUtpZ2MtMTY3OTgzMjUzNi0wLWdhTnljR3pORFZBJTIyJTJDJTIycmVmZXJyaW5nX2RvbWFpbiUyMiUzQSUyMmhhY2tlcm9uZS5jb20lMjIlN0Q=; app_signed_in=true; intercom-session-zlmaz2pu=bzZuM2JDdDhrTnFUWG1uWUJRY1B2M3VUNExvZlpaLzI3MTl3RG54aXdJcjA5MkxaVy9ROCt2NTIwRzl3ek1Jcy0tV0hUSVlYVGdPaVUyTTMzY01MSGxvZz09--38ddd56d970208e627e2c72f0ae8c6324d74baab; intercom-device-id-zlmaz2pu=81f9084c-a95c-4ea3-9bdb-2b9b205066f8
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64; rv:109.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/111.0
Accept: application/json, text/javascript, */*; q=0.01
Accept-Language: en-US,en;q=0.5
Accept-Encoding: gzip, deflate
Referer: https://hackerone.com/bugs?subject=user&report_id=1916579&view=open&substates%5B%5D=new&substates%5B%5D=needs-more-info&substates%5B%5D=pending-program-review&substates%5B%5D=triaged&substates%5B%5D=pre-submission&substates%5B%5D=retesting&reported_to_team=&text_query=&program_states%5B%5D=2&program_states%5B%5D=3&program_states%5B%5D=4&program_states%5B%5D=5&sort_type=latest_activity&sort_direction=descending&limit=25&page=1
X-Csrf-Token: /0WTxdkHSG7HTBX5Ln0CmyeSJvlbzED1XhCIVR8fj5SxVX925l1OJZp9T/Gs9mnJiZcKSF8uowuLEkgylReFIQ==
X-Requested-With: XMLHttpRequest
Sec-Fetch-Dest: empty
Sec-Fetch-Mode: cors
Sec-Fetch-Site: same-origin
Te: trailers

```

4:  you see a response like this :

```
"participant_type":"ReportParticipants::CollaboratorInvitation","id":4049018,"email":"asftngssssssssss@gmail.com","bounty_weight":"0.3"},
```

Thanks,
alone_h1

## Impact

impropper access control to view email.

activities.message:
Hi @alone_h1,

Thanks for your report. Can you clarify what the issue is with the behavior you describe? If a user specifies a collaborator's email, why would it be a vulnerability to reveal to them the email address that they had just entered for the collaborator?

Thanks,
h1_analyst_charlie

hello @h1_analyst_charlie ,

when a reporter  invited a collab via the email  and when a time the report get disclosed to public the viewer like attacker can able to view /reports/<id>/participants this path of any disclosed report and they can also view the email of collaboraters.

Thanks,
alone

Hi @alone_h1,

Thanks for the clarification. Does this only happen if the collaborator accepted the invitation, or does the email show up here if the invitation was sent but never accepted?

Thanks,
h1_analyst_charlie

hello @h1_analyst_charlie .

the email will only show up the invitation was never accepted and if the invited collab have an account in hackerone it will show up like username but if dont have an account it will remail email.

Thanks,

Hello @h1_analyst_charlie ,

Any update on your side ?

Hi @alone_h1 

Thanks for your report. We are validating this internally. We'll come back to you soon.

Regards,

Rutger

Hello @rutger77 ,

Any update on this?

Thanks

Hi @alone_h1 

Sorry, still trying to find someone to validate this. Thanks for your patience.

Rutger

hello @rutger77 ,

are you able to validate this report ?

Thanks

Hi @alone_h1 

We were able to validate this report, we are still discussing the severity of this report internally. As we're having a few days off here, this might take a bit longer. We'll get back to you as soon as possible.

Thanks for your patience! 

Rutger

Hello @rutger77 ,


Any update in this , can you triage this report?

thanks.
alone_h1
We were able to validate this report, users with access to the report can see the email address.

Hello @rutger77 ,

Can I ask why is the severity is low there is maximum impact due to no rate limit on the endpoint and attacker can bruteforce the report I'ds and obtain as much as emails from this attack.

Thanks

hello @rutger77 ,

Sorry my mistake i mistakenly asked about the severity as you said this is a low severity issue. Any update about bounty ?

thanks,
Thanks again for bringing this to our attention, it's much appreciated!

hello @chriszo111 ,

Thanks for the bounty , any update on the fix?

thanks,
alone_h1
Hey @alone_h1, the team is working on a fix. Once released we will request a retest from you. Thank you for your patience!

Thanks for bringing this to our attention :)

Looking forward to the next one!
test
